revised_title: The Liquefaction and Solidification of Argon: Experimental Findings and Critical Constants
tldr: The author investigates the liquefaction and solidification of argon, determining its critical temperature at -121°C, critical pressure at 50 atmospheres, boiling point at -187°C, and freezing point at -189.6°C. Argon is found to be the fourth most difficult to liquefy among the so-called 'permanent' gases, with properties similar to oxygen but entirely solidifiable.
